content.question: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>f</mi></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi></math> for which <math alttext="f of x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>f</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>x</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> is a real number. Let <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a differentiable function with <math alttext="f of 4 equals 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. On the interval <math alttext="0 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 7" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, the derivative of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, consists of a semicircle and two line segments, as shown in the figure. (a) Find <math alttext="f of 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f of 5" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>.

frqParts.text: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>f</mi></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi></math> for which <math alttext="f of x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>f</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>x</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> is a real number. Let <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a differentiable function with <math alttext="f of 4 equals 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. On the interval <math alttext="0 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 7" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, the derivative of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, consists of a semicircle and two line segments, as shown in the figure. (a) Find <math alttext="f of 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f of 5" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>.

(b) Find the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-coordinates of all points of inflection of the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="0 less than x, less than 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Justify your answer.

(c) Let <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="g of x equals, f of x, minus x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. On what intervals, if any, is <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> decreasing for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Show the analysis that leads to your answer.

(d) For the function <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined in part (c), find the absolute minimum value on the interval <math alttext="0 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Justify your answer.

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
